pkgmetadata.longdescription: Estimate Heterogeneous Effects in Factorial Experiments Using Grouping and Sparsity // Estimates heterogeneous effects in factorial (and conjoint) models. The methodology employs a Bayesian finite mixture of regularized logistic regressions, where moderators can affect each observation's probability of group membership and a sparsity-inducing prior fuses together levels of each factor while respecting ANOVA-style sum-to-zero constraints. Goplerud, Imai, and Pashley (2024) doi:10.48550/ARXIV.2201.01357 provide further details.
